title: init
body: <<hideif $visited-bedroom>>You awake from a delirious dream to find yourself in your childhood bedroom.<</hideif>><<if $visited-bedroom>>Your bedroom.<</if>>

title: look-window
body: Creole cottages and post-war slab homes linger beyond your window. In the distance smoke pours from the refinery. Million sits on the tailgate of the truck, staring at the glittering lights of the refinery.

title: look-computer
body: The UX500. You learned to type on this thing. You and <<$brother_name>> would stay up all night lurking chatrooms and messageboards on the meshwork, discovering new recipes for explosives, how to hack pay phones, and perhaps most critically, how to chainbreak an artificially sentient android. The night that your mom showed up with Million, you and <<$brother_name>> stayed up past dawn, pouring over pirated <<highlight-g>>Light Bionics<</highlight>> API documentation. Million idled in a slump on the floor as <<$brother_name>> and your mom watched over your shoulder while you wrote the procedure that would ultimately free her. The computer is a relic now, but you'll never give it up.

title: look-room
body: This used to be the laundry room. After your brother was born, your mom renovated it so that you could have your own bedroom. Artifacts from your childhood adorn the shelves and walls -- tapes, records, posters, old photographs. Your <<highlight-g>>UX500<</highlight>> flickers beside the <<highlight-g>>telephone<</highlight>> on a shoddy particle board desk. The chill December air drafts through the many cracks and creases of the walls. The chemical glow of the <<highlight-g>>Shield Oil Refinery<</highlight>> softly illuminates the landscape outside the window. The door facing your bed leads directly to the <<highlight-g>>backyard<</highlight>>. The door on the opposite wall goes to the <<highlight-g>>living room<</highlight>>.

title: look-photographs
body: Spread across the room are washed out photographs from cheap disposable cameras. Many are landscape shots that you took while hitchiking. A picture of you and Million hangs on the wall above the computer. It's a selfie you took in the Spillway. You were 16. Million's robotic eyes shine bright red. It was her way of smiling.

title: look-phone
body: The light on the phone <<highlight-g>>blinks red<</highlight>>, indicating a voicemail.

title: use-phone
body: You lift the phone from its cradle. There's no signal. You look at the small LED display. It reads: <<highlight-g>>please enter PIN<</highlight>>.
